text: Maria Muldaur (born in New York City, September 12, 1943) is an American singer and songwriter. Her birth name was Maria Grazia Rosa Domenica D'Amato. She is a folk-blues singer who contributed to the revival of American folk music in the early 1960s and recorded the 1974 hit song "Midnight at the Oasis". ==References== ==Other websites== Category:Singer-songwriters from New York (state) Category:1943 births Category:Living people
title: Maria Muldaur
